title: Shrimp Rolls With Lemon Chive Mayo & Arugula
summary: Shrimp Rolls With Lemon Chive Mayo & Arugula might be just the hor d'oeuvre you are searching for. One portion of this dish contains around 46g of protein, 28g of fat, and a total of 711 calories. This dairy free and pescatarian recipe serves 4 and costs $4.57 per serving. If you have shrimp, mayonnaise, watercress sprigs, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 52%, this dish is solid. Similar recipes include Crispy Shrimp with Arugulan and Lemony Mayo, Shrimp Scampi Rolls with Old Bay Mayo, and Shrimp and Chive Spring Rolls.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Rabble Pinot Gris. It has 4.9 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 20 dollars.

productMatches.title: Rabble Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Alsatian-inspired with notes of lime, green apple, white flower and wetstone. Following the nose are flavors of Anjou pear, white nectarine andcitrus. The vibrant and crisp acidity balances out this medium bodied wineand carries it through the lingering finish.
